org.mokai.persist.jdbc
Class JdbcMessageStore

java.lang.Object
  org.mokai.persist.jdbc.JdbcMessageStore
All Implemented Interfaces:
MessageStore
public class JdbcMessageStore
extends Object
implements MessageStore

An implementation of a MessageStore used to persist messages in a relational database. It uses a MessageHandler to abstract the way messages are inserted, updated, etc., allowing customization in the way in which messages are persisted (one table per message, multiple tables per message, one big table, etc.).

Author:
German Escobar

Method Detail

saveOrUpdate

public final void saveOrUpdate(Message message)
                        throws StoreException,
                               RejectedException,
                               ObjectNotFoundException,
                               IllegalStateException,
                               IllegalArgumentException
Checks if the handler supports the messages by calling the MessageHandler#supportsType(String) and MessageHandler#supportsDirection(Direction) methods. If the handler supports the message, it delegates the operation to the handler: MessageHandler.insertMessage(Connection, Message) if the message has not been persisted, or, MessageHandler.updateMessage(Connection, Message) if it is already persisted.

Specified by:
saveOrUpdate in interface MessageStore
Parameters:
message - the Message we want to save or update.
Throws:
StoreException - wraps any underlying exception from the database.
RejectedException - if the handler doesn't supports the message.
IllegalStateException - if the dataSource is null.
IllegalArgumentException - if the message is null
ObjectNotFoundException
See Also:
Message.NOT_PERSISTED
